class money_base;

The class {{lc|std::money_base}} provides constants which are inherited and used by the {{lc|std::moneypunct}}, {{lc|std::money_get}} and {{lc|std::money_put}} facets.

===Member types===
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc hitem|Type|Definition}}
{{dsc|{{c/core|enum part { none, space, symbol, sign, value };}}|unscoped enumeration type}}
{{dsc|{{c/core|struct pattern { char field[4]; };}}|the monetary format type}}
{{dsc end}}

{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc hitem|Enumeration constant|Definition}}
{{dsc|{{tt|none}}|whitespace is permitted but not required except in the last position, where whitespace is not permitted}}
{{dsc|{{tt|space}}|one or more whitespace characters are required}}
{{dsc|{{tt|symbol}}|the sequence of characters returned by {{c/core|moneypunct::curr_symbol}} is required}}
{{dsc|{{tt|sign}}|the first of the characters returned by {{c/core|moneypunct::positive_sign}} or {{c/core|moneypunct::negative_sign}} is required}}
{{dsc|{{tt|value}}|the absolute numeric monetary value is required}}
{{dsc end}}

===Notes===
The monetary format is an array of four {{c/core|char}}s convertible to {{tt|std::money_base::part}}. In that sequence, each of {{c|symbol}}, {{c|sign}}, and {{c|value}} appears exactly once, and either {{c|space}} or {{c|none}} appears in the remaining position. The value {{c|none}}, if present, is not first; the value {{c|space}}, if present, is neither first nor last.

The default format, returned by the standard specializations of {{lc|std::moneypunct}} is {{c|{symbol, sign, none, value}&lt;!----&gt;}}.
